thread.section_title: Mancheter United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic talks up potential return to Serie A – Metro
thread.title: Mancheter United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic talks up potential return to Serie A
thread.title_full: Mancheter United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic talks up potential return to Serie A

author: jsgoldman
title: Mancheter United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic talks up potential return to Serie A
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has an option to extend his Manchester United contract by a further year (Picture: Getty) Zlatan Ibrahimovic has admitted he’s contemplating a sensational return to Serie A with Napoli.
Arsene Wenger speaks out on Barcelona's interest in Hector Bellerin The iconic Manchester United striker has excelled in his first season in English football, scoring 26 goals including the vital late winner which helped secure a 3-2 win in last month’s EFL Cup final against Southampton.
The 35-year-old’s contract with United is due to expire at the end of the season and although he has an option to extend his stay by a further year, a move to Napoli has been mooted as his next destination.
Ibrahimovic scored the winning goal in last month’s EFL Cup final win over Southampton (Picture: Getty) Ibrahimovic has played for three Serie A clubs already, Milan, Juventus and Inter (Picture: Getty) Ibrahimovic has talked up the Serie A side in the past, while his agent Mino Raiola has suggested the former Juventus and Milan star would like to represent Napoli before he retires.
‘A move to Napoli? You never know,’ Ibrahimovic told Fox Sports.
‘I am feeling well at United, but we will see what happens.’
More: Football Kane issues warning to Chelsea as Tottenham take inspiration from Barcelona 
Chelsea make exciting transfer promise to Antonio Conte 
Real Madrid reach agreement with £43m star to replace Pepe this summer 
Ibrahimovic will miss Sunday’s Premier League match against Middlesbrough as he serves the second match of a three-game domestic ban for his elbow on Tyrone Mings during the 1-1 draw at Old Trafford a fortnight ago.
MORE: Gary Neville urges Jose Mourinho to offer Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal
